author: Staff Reporter
text:
A total of 1,47,430 women received maternity assistance in the last five years in the district. Apart from this, new primary health centres, maternity centres and houses for nurses were constructed at a cost of Rs. 124.74 crore.

Explaining the various development works carried by the Department of Public Health and Preventive Medicine, District Collector V. Sampath said that new Primary Health Centres were constructed at a cost of Rs. 10.85 crore in the district that facilitated improving healthcare of villagers in rural pockets.

He said that special medical camps were conducted in 20 blocks in the district every year and 25,387 were screened in 2011-12, 23,719 in 2012-13, 22,671 in 2013-14, 59,474 in 2014-15 and 60,739 screened in 2015-16 till date. Apart from this mobile medical camps were also conducted in the district, he added.

The collector said that 9,997 baby care kits were given to children so far in the district.
title: 1.47 lakh women received maternity assistance
